channel.title: Team Members – Regent College London
channel.description: HND Courses, Foundation Year, Top-Up and Bachelor Degrees

item.title: Dr Posi Olatubosun
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description: The post Dr Posi Olatubosun appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Dr Posi Olatubosun is an experienced investment banker, stockbroker, auditor and tax practitioner. He is a Fellow member of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (FCCA), Chartered Institute of Securities and Investment (FCSI) and the Advance Higher Education (FHEA). His PhD thesis in the area of accounting and financial management was awarded by the University of Sheffield, titled “Exploring ESG-Shareholder Activism in the UK”. The thesis investigated and analysed longitudinal investor engagement from a risk society perspective, thereby widening the understanding of corporate governance. His research interest includes shareholder activism, responsible investment, active institutional asset ownership, integrated reporting, extinction accounting and biodiversity reporting. His teaching interest covers taxation, accounting and corporate finance.

The post Dr Posi Olatubosun appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Kirielle Mbone
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description: The post Kirielle Mbone appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Kirielle joined Regent College London in March 2021 as a Registry Officer. She graduated from the University of Kent with a BA (Hons) in French and Business Administration.

Before Regent, she worked in the further education sector in France. She is fluent in both French and English. She enjoys working within the education environment as she has a passion for helping others, especially supporting student’s academic journeys. Her aim to fulfil this passion with Regent College London.

The post Kirielle Mbone appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Dr Denise Jackson
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description: The post Dr Denise Jackson appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Dr Denise Jackson has taught Sociology, Psychology, Criminology and Social Sciences across a range of programmes and organisations throughout her 30 year teaching career, ranging from A Level through to Honours Level Degree. She has a PhD in Sociology entitled: ‘Geeks, Boffins, Swots and Nerds: A Social Constructionist Analysis of Gifted and Talented Identities in Post-16 Education’ (https://discovery.ucl.ac.uk/id/eprint/10021821/); Masters’ Degrees in Educational Management; and in Research Methods; a First Class BSc in Sociology and is a qualified teacher with QTS.

She is passionate about Sociology, Education and in supporting Students to achieve their potential by making academic material accessible. She is a working class ‘Essex Girl’ who had children at a young age, completing her studies whilst supporting a family and working. Juggling responsibilities was challenging; but she found flexible studying and knowing that she was striving to improve her family’s life chances, motivated her to work hard, find ways of managing time, and gave her the determination to succeed. She feels that if she could, our students could too and she is looking forward to being part of your journey on your road to your success.

The post Dr Denise Jackson appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Sayan Roy
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description: The post Sayan Roy appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Sayan joined Regent in 2021. He has done his diploma certification from Film and Television Institute, Pune in Digital Video Editing. He is passionate about working closely with people to produce authentic and meaningful stories that engage and inspire.

He is experienced in working across different media and enjoys continuously developing his skills through exciting projects.

The post Sayan Roy appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Dr Benneth C Nwafor
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description: The post Dr Benneth C Nwafor appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Dr Benneth C Nwafor is currently a senior lecturer in Management in the United Kingdom. He has degrees in Accountancy, Master of Business Administration (MBA) and PhD in Business Strategic Management and Human Resource Management. He has worked in both public and private sectors, building project manager and assistant to the auditing panel.

The post Dr Benneth C Nwafor appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Mohamed Mohamed
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description: The post Mohamed Mohamed appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Mohamed is an articulate, highly knowledgeable Internal Control & Profit Protection expert with 14+ years of auditing policies, procedures and risk management. He is a certified Internal Auditor (CIA) with a wide range of knowledge, skills and experience relating to internal controls providing sound business advice and guidance, that will allow him to contribute toward the success of our organisation.

His expertise lies in identifying risks, improving processes and reducing losses by suggesting improvements, delivering training and increasing awareness.

The post Mohamed Mohamed appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Victor Torres
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description: The post Victor Torres appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Victor Joined Regent College in March 2019, having previously obtained a degree in Design and Marketing at Central Saint Martins and worked for three years in the fashion design industry.

He started Regent College as Academic Administration but evolved into his current position in Resource Planning in October 2020.

His responsibilities include compiling reports to support the planning and smooth running of College activities. He reports to the Academic Dean, but works closely with multiple stakeholders across the organisation.

The post Victor Torres appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Katrina Castilla
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description: The post Katrina Castilla appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
With a BA (Hons) in Education Studies from UCL Institute of Education, Katrina has over 10 years of experience in the Early Years sector and as an Education Consultant supporting students with admissions for independent schools and universities.

The post Katrina Castilla appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Cara Ludik
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description: The post Cara Ludik appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Cara has 5 years of experience in the customer service and hospitality industry and is currently studying toward her degree in Marine Biology.

Cara values hard work, integrity and kindness.

 

The post Cara Ludik appeared first on Regent College London.
